ğ“€  â‰ˆ ğ“¨ â‰ˆ ğ“ â‰ˆ ğ“€¢ â‰ˆ ğ“€¤ â‰ˆ ğ“€¥  <>  ó³­ ó³® ó³¯ ó³° ó³± ó³² ó³³ ó³´ ó³µ ó³¶ ó³· ó³¸ ó³¹ ó³º ó³» ó³¼ ó³½ ó³¾ ó³¿ ó³‚€  

Harakam > Halaham was the earliest [Alphabet](Alphabet.html)ic ordering of signs, attested since 1500BC, together with the Abjad. The Abjad belonging to North-Eastern Semitic traditions and the Halaham to Southern Arabic / Semitic traditions, but also reaching as far north as Syria.

It seems to be intricately connected to hymns, songs and jubilations:

ğ“ Halaham â‰ˆ ğ“‰” ğ“„¿ ğ“² ğ“› ğ“¥ ğ“‰” ğ“ˆ–  Hairu'hamun â‰ˆ [Horus](Horus.html) Hymn ğ“€  ğ©  Hail [Amun](Amun.html) 

ğ“› ğ“‚ ğ“€  ğ“œ | rejoice | ğ“‚“ Ï‡Î±ÏÎ¬ kharÃ¡ hurrah hurray 

ğ“‰” ğ“‡‹ ğ“‡‹ ğ“‰” ğ“ˆ– ğ“Œ ğ“…± ğ“€¤ | jubilate | â€¢hailhamunur

[Ugaritic](Ugaritic.html) @ Beth Shemesh :

Notes
As with later alphabets, the 'representatives' of each phone had different semantics.
The forms where visually deliberately detached from numbering systems: ğ…	ğ	ğƒ ğ
Yet there are strong connections to [Numbers](Numbers.html)

# 28 cubit
The [28](28.html) cubit on old Egyptian measuring rods were previously assumed to represent or connect to some form of ancient Alphabet.

It is weakly compatible with the Harashamun form ğ“€  ğ“² ğ“‡“ ğ“ˆ– of the Halaham:

h r á¸¥ m q w  Å¡/á¹¯ r  b/Ã¸ t á¸/Ã¸ Å¡/s
 ğ“‡³   ğ“†„   ğ“˜ ğ“…­ ğ“Œğ“ğ“‡¯ ğ“Š¨ğ“¹ ğ“Š¨ğ“ ğ“ƒ« ğ“‰ 

ğ“‡³ hara
ğ“†„  Å¡um
ğ“˜  qwÊ³
ğ“…­ baá¹¯ / Å¡aá¹¯ / Å¡aâ¿ 
ğ“Œğ“ğ“‡¯ â¿á¹¯'air / ğ“Œğ“ orbit r-b-t
ğ“Š¨ğ“¹ áµ‡voir
ğ“Š¨ğ“  t/á¸
ğ“ƒ« á¸ â€¦ Å¡
ğ“‰  Nephthys 9áµ—Ê° â‰  ğ“°ğ“ğ“ Bastet

There is no clear connection between early [alphabet](alphabet.html)s such as [Halaham](Halaham.html) and
3 * 9 = 27 [Zodiac](Zodiac.html)s as in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakshatra
